uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.expr

Interface Accessor<T,R>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of return value
    R - target object
    All Superinterfaces:
    Targetted<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FieldSQLExpression<T,X>, FieldValue<T,X>, SQLAccessor<T,R>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSelfSQLValue, BooleanFieldExpression, ConstExpression, DateFieldExpression, DurationAccessor, DurationFieldValue, FieldExpression, IndexedFieldValue, IntConvertAccessor, MillisecondAccessor, NumberFieldExpression, SelectAccessor, SelfSQLValue, SQLSelectAccessor, StringConvertAccessor, StringFieldExpression, TimestampDateFieldExpression, TupleSelfSQLValue, TypeFilterProducerSQLValue, TypeProducerFieldValue

    public interface Accessor<T,R>
extends Targetted<T>
    Interface that encodes data access operation on a target object. These are usually defined with a DataObject as the target

    An Accessor that can provide Filters based on the result type implements FilterProvider

    An Accessor that also allows access via SQL implements SQLAccessor.

    Unless an Accessor implements one or the other it won't be able to be used to filter results.

    Author:
    spb
